title: What is the first name in a scientific name called? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you are talking living things, classification is called taxonomy and there are 7 “levels” of description used in order: Kingdom Phylum Class Order Family Genus Species identifier However these are rarely used in full to identify a living thing. For instance the Eurasean wren is known as Troglodytes (genus) troglodytes (species identifier)and that is sufficient to identify it. In full it is Animalia (kingdom), Chordata (phylum), Aves (class), Passeriformes (order), Certhioides (family), followed by troglodytes twice.

Do you want the entire list of classification? Domain, Kingdom, Phylum, Class, Order, Genus, Species. Usually Latin or Greek. Scientific names for specific species are formed by the Genus and Species. Ie: Lupus familiaris - a dog. Ursus arctus - Brown bear
